instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
Clean board looks brand new and no liquid damage to be found.

There is no USB activity and obviously no external or internal image.

Mac allows me to restore T2 but that did nothing.

CPU gets hot and after a while fan spins, when charger is connected I hear chime for charging.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5.12 volts
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_CPU</SIGNAL> = 12.64 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUCORE_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 0 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUCORE_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 0 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PHASE2</SIGNAL> = 0 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUGT_PHASE1</SIGNAL> = 0 volts
<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PHASE</SIGNAL> = 0.97 volts
<SIGNAL>CPUSA_SW_LL</SIGNAL> = 1.03 volts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
Compare ohm readings on CPU coils with good board.
Probably dead CPU in this case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message: Don't have good board on this one, if anyone has measurements that will be great, but sounds like dead CPU

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message: I should be getting one of this boards in shortly, the coils you mention are L7410, L8102, L7430, L7210, L7230 and L7290 correct? Did I missed or added to many?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
CPUCORE and CPUGT...

But is good to make a list for each board model, when you finish the repair, with more test points.
This way you can build personal database, for future help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
Ok I got a working board and here are the comparisons measured in Î©:

CPUCORE good board 12.5
CPUCORE bad board 8.8

CPUGT good board 9.2
CPUGT bad board 4.4

Should I look elsewhere for why this board doesn't start or is this CPU dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No brain
threads.message:
Probably different CPU, check that.
If is same, then must have very similar values...
